title: Police: NC State's Thornton arrested after moped accident
text:
NC State dismisses Thornton after arrest for moped accident Posted: By AARON BEARDAP Sports Writer 
RALEIGH, N.C. (AP) - North Carolina State has dismissed running back Shadrach Thornton from the team after another round of legal troubles. 
Coach Dave Doeren announced the decision in a statement Wednesday afternoon. That came less than a day after Raleigh police arrested Thornton following an accident in which he struck a pedestrian while riding a moped on a sidewalk and then left the scene. 
An accident report states the pedestrian needed stitches for a facial injury. 
Thornton, last year's leading rusher, had recently returned from a two-game suspension for a violation of athletic department policy. It was the senior's third suspension, the first two coming after brushes with the law in 2013. 
Doeren said it was "an unfortunate set of circumstances." The school says Thornton is on track to graduate in the spring.
